descriptionSet.description: In this poster from the Ajanta Art Calender Mfg. Co., Madras two girls can be seen in a forest. One girl is petting a fawn while the other arranges the flowers in the hair of the first girl. The girls are wearing jewellery and are dressed in a bustier and skirt. One of the girls has a transparent dupatta (stole) draped over her head. The tree behind the girls is a banyan tree as we can see its aerial roots. In the distance on the left a man can be seen approaching with a bow and arrow. On the right a hut with a thatched roof can be seen. The scene is part of the ancient Indian play about Shakuntala written by Kalidasa.

inscription.text: Ajanta Art Calendar Mfg. Co. 17, Godown Street, P. B. No. 255 Madras-1

description-en: In this poster from the Ajanta Art Calender Mfg. Co., Madras two girls can be seen in a forest. One girl is petting a fawn while the other arranges the flowers in the hair of the first girl. The girls are wearing jewellery and are dressed in a bustier and skirt. One of the girls has a transparent dupatta (stole) draped over her head. The tree behind the girls is a banyan tree as we can see its aerial roots. In the distance on the left a man can be seen approaching with a bow and arrow. On the right a hut with a thatched roof can be seen. The scene is part of the ancient Indian play about Shakuntala written by Kalidasa. (sp)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: This image possibly depicts a scene from Kalidasa's famous play 'Abhijnanasakuntalam'. The man with the bow and arrows seen approaching the girl is possibly Dushyant who Shakuntala later marries. The banyan tree is considered sacred in Hinduism. Shakunthala is a local variation in spelling, possibly south Indian, of Shakuntala.
related hyperlinks: http://www.yorku.ca/inpar/shakuntala_ryder.pdf, last accessed 2011-08-01, Pdf of the English translation of the play by Arthur W Ryder
related hyperlinks: http://sanskritdocuments.org/all_sa/shaakuntala_sa.html, last accessed 2011-08-01, Sanskrit version of the play (sp)
